response.original_title: Witchmen: Witch Trials in the Land of Fire & Ice
response.overview: 17th century Iceland was a remote place. But its isolation didnâ€™t stop it getting caught in one of the most horrifying crazes of the time, the witch hunts. But in the breathtaking landscape of Iceland something was different. In Iceland 93% of witches killed were men. Dr Kate Lister is on a mission to find out why.
